etymology.description: something (丶) in the ladle or spoon (勹).
etymology.interpretation: A dot represents contents being scooped, while 勹 shows the curved scoop of a ladle. The graph pictures a small item inside a scoop, evoking the function of a spoon or ladle.

examples.chinese: 请用勺子把汤盛出来(請用勺子把湯盛出來)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng yòng sháozi bǎ tāng chéng chūlái.
examples.english: Please use a spoon to ladle the soup out.

examples.chinese: 他舀了一勺糖放进杯子里(他舀了一勺糖放進杯子裡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǎo le yì sháo táng fàng jìn bēizi lǐ.
examples.english: He scooped a spoonful of sugar into the cup.

examples.chinese: 在这个食谱里，一勺等于十五毫升(在這個食譜裡，一勺等於十五毫升)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhège shípǔ lǐ, yì sháo děngyú shíwǔ háoshēng.
examples.english: In this recipe, one spoonful equals fifteen milliliters.
